nya: Ngakhale a khoti lalikulu analetsa zionetsero zomwe anakonzazo, otsatira chipani cha Movement for Democratic Change analowa mmisewu ndikukalimbana ndi apolisi, Ena mwa amene anavulala  anaimba mlandu apolisiwo posokoneza zionetserozo, zomwe anati zinali zokakamizira boma la  mtsogoleri wa dzikolo a Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti lidzetse moyo mu chuma chakufa cha dziko la Zimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> Although the high court banned the protests, supporters of the Movement for Democratic Change went on the streets and fought with police. Some of the injured blamed the police for disrupting the protests, which they said were meant to force the government of President Emmerson Mnangagwa to revive the dead economy of Zimbabwe.</s>

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
nya: Ndi misonzi mmaso mwawo, mzimayi wa zaka 32 a Tafadzwa Bvuta anati pepala lawo la digiri silinawathandize kuwapezera chithandizo chilichonse ana awo atatu.
mt0: <pad> With tears in their eyes, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her bachelor's degree didn't help her get any medical treatment for her three children.</s>

en: "They beat us up," she said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all — not just one person. Where will we go and survive? Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
nya: "amatimenya," ananena apolisiwo. "Tachita chiyani? Gulu la chitetezoli limayenera kutetenza tonse osati munthu mmodzi. Tipita kuti kokapulumukira? Tiphe ana athu chifukwa tikuvutika kuwasamalira?"
mt0: <pad> "They're being beaten," the police said. "What have we done? This security team should be protecting us all, not just one person. Where do we go to escape? To give our children up for their hardships to take care of them? Where do we go to escape?</s>

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
nya: A make Nyashanu a zaka 27 anati apitiliza kuchita zionetsero chifukwa iwowo ndiwokwiya ndi kusalembedwa ntchito.
mt0: <pad> 27 year old Mohammed, who is angry with unemployment, said he will continue to protest.</s>

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators — even elderly ones and people not protesting. "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
nya: Iwo anati apolisi amamenya mosasankha anthu opanga zionetserowo, ngakhale anthu achikulire ndi ena oti samachita nawo zionetsero. "Kodi umenewu ndi ufulu wa demokalase?" iye anafunsa, kuphatikizapo kuti zinali zionetsero za mtendere koma apolisi anachititsa chisokonezo.
mt0: <pad> They said police hit protesters with impunity, even elderly and non-protesters. "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that they were peaceful protests but the police caused disorder.</s>

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
nya: Otsutsa boma anati achitanso zionetsero Lolemba ku mzinda waukulu wachiwiri ku Zimbabwe wa Bulawayo, ndipo adzapitanso ku mizinda ina pokhapokha boma litayankhulapo ndi kuchita kanthu pa nkhani ya chuma chadzikolo.
mt0: <pad> The government critics said they will stage another protest on Monday in the second-largest city of Zimbabwe, Bulawayo, and will continue to march in other cities unless the government speaks up and acts on the country's economic problems.</s>

en: Government response
nya: Yankho la Boma.
mt0: <pad> The government's response is simply to say you don't know.</s>

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
nya: Nduna ya zofalitsa nkhani a Monica Mutsvangwa anafotokoza kuti zionetserozo  ndizosapindulitsa, anati zionetsero za mwezi wa Januwale zotsutsana ndi kukwera kwa mafuta, kunachititsa kuti ndalama za ma dola  zapakatikati pa 20 ndi 30 miliyoni  zitayike chifukwa cha  kuba komanso kusagwira ntchito kwa masiku.
mt0: <pad> The minister of information Monica Mutsvangwa described the protests as unproductive, saying that the January protests against the rise in oil costs caused a loss of between $20 and $30 million dollars in damages and disruptions to business.</s>

en: "Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner," she said. "I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation."
nya: Boma lauza anthu onse opita patsogolo a boma la Zimbabwe kuti asalore kugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi mphamvu zosakhala bwino kuti dziko lawo lisakhazikike, ati izi zingopitiliza mavuto omwe dzikolo lukukumana nawo pamene dzikolo likuyesetsa kukonza kuti likhazikike, iwo anatero, nkanakonda anthu anakamvera mtsogoleri wathu powaitana kuti tikonze mavuto omwe tikukumana nawowa mwa umodzi ngati dziko.
mt0: <pad> The government has told all the progressist people of Zimbabwe that they should not allow their country to be used by unstable forces to destabilize it, saying that this will only prolong the problems that the country is experiencing while it is trying to rebuild itself, they said. I wish the people had listened to our leader who called for us to solve the problems we are facing together as a nation.</s>

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018. He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
nya: A Daniel Molokhele, mneneri wa otsutsa boma, anati chipani chawo sichikugwirizana ndi zomwe a Mnangagwa akuyankhula ndipo anawaimba mlandu obera zisankho za chaka cha 2018. Iwo anati zionetsero zipitilira pokhapokha chuma cha dziko la Zimbabwe chibwelere mmalo mwake.
mt0: <pad> Daniel Molokhele, a spokesman for the opposition party, said they did not agree with Mnangagwa's statement and accused him of fraud in the 2018 election. The protests will continue until the Zimbabwean economy is restored to its normal state.</s>

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
nya: A bungwe la UN adzudzula boma la Zimbabwe pa mchitidwe wolanga anthu pa zionetsero zamtendere zomwe zinachitika.
mt0: <pad> UN has condemned the government of Zimbabwe for its use of force against demonstrators during peace protests.</s>

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare. The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
nya: Ofesi ya ufulu wa anthu ya U.N yadzudzula mchitidwe wolanga anthu Lachisanu ku Zimbabwe pa chipolowe chomwe apolisi anachititsa pa zionetsero za mtendere mu mzinda wa Harare. Nthambiyi yayambitsa kufufuza nkhaniyi pogwiritsa ntchito mphamvu za asilikali a chitetezo.
mt0: <pad> UN Human Rights Office has condemned the use of force by police on Friday against peace protesters in Harare. The government has launched an investigation into the incident.</s>

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
nya: Mneneri wa ufulu wa anthu ku bungwe la U.N a Rupert Colville anati pali njira zabwino zothana ndi mavuto omwe anthu akulira nawo pa nkhani ya chuma cha dziko kusiyana ndi kuzunza anthuwa pochita zionetsero za mtendere.
mt0: <pad> UN human rights spokesman Rupert Colville said there are better ways to deal with the problems people are complaining about in the world than to punish them for their peacefull protests.</s>

en: "We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe. While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans," Colville said.
nya: Ndife okhudzidwa kwambiri ndi mavuto a zachuma ndi chikhalidwe omwe akuchitikabe ku Zimbabwe. Povomeleza khama la boma, bungwe la dziko lonse ndi la U.N ku Zimbabwe pochepetsa mavutowa komanso kusintha ndondomeko, vuto la chuali likukhudza mosakhala bwino ufulu wa khalidwe ndi chuma wa anthu a ku Zimbabwe, A Colville anatero.
mt0: <pad> We are deeply concerned with the ongoing economic and social problems in Zimbabwe. Despite the efforts of the government, international community and UN in Zimbabwe to address these problems and change the system, the current situation is affecting the rights of the people and the economy of Zimbabwe," Colville said.</s>

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care. Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
nya: Mzika za dziko la Zimbabwe zikuvutika ndi kukwera  mitengo kwambiri kwa zinthu, monga zinthu ngati mafuta agalimoto, chakudya, mayendedwe komanso chisamaliro cha moyo zakwera mitengo. Poonjezela mavutowo mphepo yaikulu yotchedwa Cyclone Idai yomwe inaomba dziko la  Zimbabwe mwezi wa Malichi ndi chilala chachikulu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabweans are suffering from high prices, such as car oil, food, transport and medical care. Cyclone Idai which hit Zimbabwe in March and a massive drought have added to the problems.</s>

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
nya: A bungwe la United nations anati gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a anthu 16 miliyoni a dziko la zimbabwe akufunika chithandizo.
mt0: <pad> United nations said one-third of the 16 million people in Zimbabwe need medical treatment.</s>

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear. But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
nya: Chomwe chinachititsa kuvulazidwa ndi kumangidwa kwa anthu kuchokera Lachisanu sichikudziwika. Koma a Colville anauza wailesi ya VOA kuti ofesi yawo yalandira malipoti osakhala bwino ophwanya malamulo a ufulu wa anthu pa miyezi yapitayo.
mt0: <pad> What caused the injuries and arrests on Friday is not known. But Colville told the VOA that his office has received reports of serious human rights violations in recent months.</s>

en: "There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders. We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago," Colville said. "So, it is clearly a very tense situation."
nya: "Monga mmene ndinafotokozera pali malipoti  amene akubwera okhudza kutenga anthu mokakamiza, kumenyedwa  ndi zina zambiri kwa anthu omenyera ufulu. Sitinapeze mwayi wotsimikizira ndikuona bwinobwino kupatula zomwe zinachitika masiku apitawa," a Colville anatero. "Iyi ndi nyengo yovuta kwambiri."
mt0: <pad> "As I have said, there are reports of arbitrary arrests, beatings and other things against freedom fighters. We haven't had the chance to verify or see it well enough except for what happened in the past few days," Colville said. "This is a very difficult time."</s>

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
nya: A Colville anati akuluakulu aboma ali ndi udindo woonetsetsa kuti ufulu wa kayankhulidwe wa anthu ndi kusonkhana mwa mtendere ukutetezedwa.
mt0: <pad> Colville said authorities have the responsibility to ensure that the right to free speech and peaceful assembly is protected.</s>

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
nya: Bungwe la ufulu wa anthu la U.N lapempha boma kuti lionetsetse kuti anthu osagwira ntchito m'boma mu njira iliyonse azichita zinthu opanda mantha a ntchito yawo.
mt0: <pad> The UN Human Rights Organization has urged the government to ensure that non-governmental workers in any way can perform their work without fear of retribution.</s>

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
nya: Ngakhale pali mafuta osungidwa, Africa wakhudzidwa ndi kukwera mtengo kwa mphamvu zochokera ku mafuta.
mt0: <pad> Although there are oil reserves, Africa is affected by the rise in oil-based energy costs.</s>

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
nya: Anthu a ku Afilika akupeza mavuto ndi kukwera kwa mafuta ndi mphamvu ya magetsi, anatero ounguza, ngakhalenso maiko a Nigeria ndi Angola amene amagulitsa  mafuta ku maiko ena.
mt0: <pad> Africans are facing problems with the rising cost of oil and power, according to analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that export oil.</s>

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue – especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 – much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
nya: Pamene opanga mafuta ochepa ena akupeza ndalama yochuluka, chiyambileni kuukila kwa dziko la Russia ku Ukraine pa 24 Febuluwale,  dzikoli likukanika kukonza mafutawa zomwe zikukakamiza maiko kulipira mitengo yokwera kuti abweretse  mafuta ndi zina kuchokera kmaiko a ku  Asia ndi ku Ulaya.
mt0: <pad> While some oil producers are making a lot of money, since Russia's invasion in Ukraine on February 24, the country has been unable to produce oil, which has forced countries to pay higher prices to import oil and other products from Asia and Europe.</s>

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
nya: Dziko likupitilira kukhudzidwa ndi kukwera mtengo  kwa mafuta a chilengedwe amene amaagwiritsidwa ntchito mu feteleza wokulitsa mbewu za chakudya.
mt0: <pad> The country continues to be affected by the rising cost of natural oil used in fertilizer for food seed production.</s>

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
nya: Ndi malipiro kukhala chimodzimodzi, kupitilira magawo awiri pa atatu a anthu a ku Afilika akumva kukakamizidwa ndi kukwera mitengo anatero a Franklin Cudjoe mtsogoleri wa malo otchedwa Imani Cennter for Policy and Education dziko la Ghana.
mt0: <pad> With wages remaining the same, over two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rise in prices," said Franklin Cudjoe, director of the Imani Centre for Policy and Education in Ghana.</s>

en: "The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products," Cudjoe told VOA.
nya: Gawo la dzikoli lakhudzidwa kwambiri chifukwa timadalira kwambiri  kugula mafuta ochokera ku maiko ena, monga maiko ambiri aku Afilika alibe mafuta opanga okha," a Cudjoe anauza wailesi ya VOA.
mt0: <pad> The sector has been affected very much because we are heavily reliant on importing oil from other countries, as many African countries do not produce their own oil," Cudjoe told the VOA radio station.</s>

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude. The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
nya: Mitengo inakwera pa msika wa dziko lonse pambuyo pa kuukilidwa kwa dziko la Ukraine komwe kunayambitsa kusintha kwa malamulo a dziko lonse motsutsana ndi dziko la Russia, limodzi mwa maiko otumiza mafuta ku maiko ena. Mwachidule mtengo unakwera kuposela pa 120 dolazi pa galoni iliyonse lachisanu asanagwirizane zotsitsa kufika pa 103 dolazi.
mt0: <pad> The prices of oil rose on the world market after the crisis in Ukraine led to international sanctions against Russia, one of the major exporters of oil. In short, the price of oil rose more than 120 dollars per gallon on Friday before a deal was reached to bring it down to 103 dollars per gallon on Monday.</s>

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa. In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
nya: Kukwera mitengo kwamphamvu  ya magetsi, ndikomwe kukuchititsa kukwera mitengo ya zinthu ku Afilika. Mwachitsanzo ku Ghana kukwera mitengo ya zinthu kunali pa 15.7 pelesenti chaka ndi chaka kusiyana ndi 13.9 pelesenti mu Januwale, kuchokera ku  chiwelengero cha dzikolo.
mt0: <pad> The rise in energy costs, is also contributing to the rising prices of goods in Africa. For example in Ghana the inflation rate was 15.7 percent year on year compared to 13.9 percent in January, from the national index of the country.</s>

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply – even overnight. At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday. The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
nya: Ku dziko la Zimbabwe mitengo ikukwera kwambiri. Sitolo ina yotchedwa TM ku Harare, kileti ya mazira 30 ndi ma dolazi okwana 6.70 lachiwiri, lachitatu anali ma dolazi okwana 7.81. Mtengo wa mkate unachoka pa ma dolazi okwana 1.49 kufika pa 1.84,  Nyama ya n''gombe inachoka pa ma dolazi okwana 3.35 kufika pa 5.22
mt0: <pad> In Zimbabwe the prices are soaring. At a store in Harare, 30 eggs were 6.70 on Tuesday, and on Wednesday was 7.81. The price of bread went from 1.49 to 1.84, the price of pork went from 3.35 to 5.15.</s>

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
nya: Mitengo ya mafuta inakweranso.  Ku Harare mtengo pa lita mtengo unakwera kuchoka pa ma dolazi okwana 1.41 kufika 1.69 kuchoka Lachiwiri kufika Lachitatu.
mt0: <pad> The price of oil has gone up again. In Harare the price of a liter increased from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.</s>

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
nya: Kukwera kwa mitengo ya zakudya ndi komwe kunachititsa kukwera mitengo kwa ogula zinthu mu dziko la  Aigupto (Egypt), inakwera kufika pa  8.8 % mwezi wa Febuluwale. Kukwera kwachangu mu zaka zitatu, malinga ndi ziwerengero za nthambi ya CAPMAS.
mt0: <pad> The increase in food prices has led to the inflation in Egypt, which rose to 8.8% in February. The fastest growth in three years, according to the CAPMAS branch.</s>

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
nya: A Cudjoe anati zinali zovuta kwa maboma  ndi madera ngati a African Union kuti apange njira zodzitetezera podzathandizira anthu ogula zinthu mu nyengo ya kusatsimikizika kwa chuma.
mt0: <pad> Cudjoe said it was difficult for governments and regions like the African Union to create a safety net to support consumers during a period of economic uncertainty.</s>

en: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food," said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
nya: Ngakhale kutamangidwa chitetezo  mu njira yopeleka chakudya," anatero a Cudjoe poonjezera, "Ndikulingalira dziko la Nigeria, linakakhala ndi njira yake bwezi likugulitsa chakudya  ku maiko ambiri motsika mtengo panopa."
mt0: <pad> Even though there is no security in the food delivery system," Cudjoe added, "I think Nigeria, if it had its own system, would be exporting food to many other countries at a lower price now."</s>

en: "There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world."
nya: "Pakuyenera kukhala changu chodzimangira chitetezo, ndalama zoti zitha kutisunga-zotipewetsa kuwonongeka ku kusatsimikizidwa kwa  zinthu zochitika pa dzilo lonse.
mt0: <pad> "There must be an urgent need for security, savings-to prevent the losses from global uncertainty.</s>

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
nya: A Chibamba kanyama, oona zachuma mu mzinda wa Lusaka ku Zambia, anati kuchotsa misonkho ya mafuta chitha kukhala chinthu choyenera kuchita panopa ndi nyengoyi poteteza anthu ogula ndi mafakitale.
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: "African governments must find a way of responding," he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
nya: "Maiko a dera la Afilika akuyenera kupeza  njira yolowelerapo," iwo anatero.  Ali ndi chisankho chotsitsa misonkho kuti atsitse mitengo yazinthu kapena kusiya mitengo yomweyo ndi kugwiritsa ntchito ndalama za boma kuti atsitse mitengo kwa anthu ofuna chithandizo.
mt0: <pad> "African countries need to find a way to get in," they said. They have the choice of lowering taxes to lower prices or keeping the same prices and using government money to lower the cost of medical care for people in need.</s>

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
nya: Koma a Kanyama anapereka maganizo oti zovuta za maiko zomwe zikuchitika pakati pa Russia ndi Ukraine amene ali maiko ogulitsa katundu ku Afilika, zitha kupereka mwayi ochuluka  kwa opanga zinthu zosiyanasiyana ku Afilika.
mt0: <pad> But Mr Kanyama suggested that the diplomatic tensions between Russia and Ukraine, which are major exporters to Africa, could provide a great deal of opportunities for African producers.</s>

en: "Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
nya: Maiko ogulitsa zinthu ngati South Africa, amene ali ndi machitidwe amakina amphamvu, atha kupeza mwayi wotumiza kunja zithu ngati  tirigu, ndi zina zomwe asiya mpata a maiko a Russia ndi Ukraine," anatero a Kanyama.
mt0: <pad> South African exporters, which have strong machinery systems, can take advantage of the opportunities that Russia and Ukraine have left behind," Kanyama said.</s>

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
nya: A kanyama anatinso thandizo lochokera ku gulu lonse la dziko lapansi mwachitsanzo ngongole kwa maiko ena aku Afilika ndilolandiridwa.
mt0: <pad> A kanyama also said that international aid such as loans to other African countries was welcome.</s>

en: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
nya: Iwo anazindikira magulu makumi awiri a maiko a mafakitale ochuluka, maiko ena a chuma chochuluka msanga, ndi  Mgwirizano wa maiko a ku Ulaya, "ukuyesa kupereka thandizo la ngongole."
mt0: <pad> They identified the two dozen industrialized countries, some rapidly developing economies, and the European Union, "trying to provide financial aid."</s>

en: "Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis," Kanyama added.
nya: Maiko ena ngati Zambia a kukonzanzo ndondomeko yawo ya ngongole ndi pologalamu ya IMF imene kwa ineyo ndi njira yokhayo yotulukira mavutowa," anatero a Kanyama.
mt0: <pad> Other countries like Zambia are restructuring their debt and IMF program which I think is the only way to overcome this problem," he said.</s>

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
nya: Nkhani iyi idachokera ku VOA  English-to-Africa service, ndi thandizo lochokera kwa otumikira a ku  Zimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> This article was originally published by the VOA English-to-Africa service, with help from our Zimbabwean correspondents.</s>

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
nya: Bungwe la WHO lati Katemera wa COVID ku africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 ena alionse(15%) mu mwezi wa February
mt0: <pad> The WHO said that the vaccine for COVID in Africa grew by 15 per cent on 100 people (15%) in June.</s>

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
nya: Bungwe la World Health Organisation lati katemera wa COVID 19 ku Africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 alionse (15%) pakati pa mwezi wa January ndi February
mt0: <pad> The World Health Organization says the vaccination rate for COVID 19 in Africa has increased by 15 per cent (15%) between January and February.</s>

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe likukhazikitsa ntchito yolimbikitsa katemera m'dziko lawo lonse "National vaccination blitz" yomwe cholinga chake n'cholimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse katemera m'dzikoli lomwe vuto lokana kubayitsa linali lalikulu chiyambireni ntchitoyi chaka chatha. Ntchitoyi ikulimbikitsidwa malingana ndi kukwera kwa chiwerengero cha anthu opezeka ndi kachilombo ka COVID 19. Dr. Matshidiso Moeti omwe ndi  regional director wa WHO ku Africa mu mawu ake anati kukwera kwa kubayitsa kwa katemera wa COVID-19 kunalimbikitsidwa makamaka chifukwa cha ntchito zofalitsa uthengawu mu mayiko omwe ali ndi chiwerengero cha anthu ambili kumbaphatikizirapo mayiko a Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya ndi Nigeria
mt0: <pad> The government of Zimbabwe is launching a national vaccination blitz to boost the number of people who did not get vaccinated in the country which had a large problem with refusing to get vaccinated since the start of the program last year.</s>

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
nya: Dr. Thierno Balde, omwe ndi regional COVID-19 incident manager wa WHO ku Africa wati anthu a mu kontinentiyi akhalebe atcheru
mt0: <pad> Dr. Thierno Balde, regional COVID-19 incident manager of the WHO in Africa has urged people in the continent to remain vigilant about the outbreak.</s>

en: "We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
nya: "Taona zomwe zikuchitika ku China, komanso kuopsa kokhala ndi machitidwe ena ofananizidwa ndi kachilomboka, mitundu ina ya kachilomboka yomwe ili ndi kuthekera kwakupezeka
mt0: <pad> We have seen what is happening in China, and the danger of having other virus-related infections, other viruses that have the potential to infect.</s>

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
nya: WHO inati pofuna kuthandizira kuvomerezedwa kwa kamtemera wa COVID 19, ilo komanso ma bungwe ena amathandizira kubayitsa kwa namtindi wa anthu mu mayiko osankhidwa osachepera 10 ndi cholinga chofikira anthu 100 miliyoni pakutha pa mwezi wa mawa
mt0: <pad> WHO said that to help support the adoption of COVID 19, it and other organizations are supporting mass immunization in at least 10 selected countries with the goal of reaching 100 million people by the end of June.</s>

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
nya: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu amene akugwilizira mpando wa nduna ya zofalitsa nkhani anatidziko lake silitsalira pa mbuyo
mt0: <pad> The acting minister of information Mangaliso Ndlovu said his country will not go backwards.</s>

en: "Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
nya: "pokhadzana ndi ndondomeko ya kubaya katemera, pochokera pa 15 March 2022 kufikira tsiku la lero, anthu okwana 159, 628 analandira kubayitsa kwa chitatu kwa katemerayu. Ntchito yakubayitsa katemera mu dziko lonse wotchedwa 'National vaccination blitz' uyamba pa 21 March 2022 ndipo boma likulimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse kuti atengerepo mwayi pa ntchitoyi" anatero Ndlovu
mt0: <pad> "in relation to the vaccination programme, from 15 March 2022 to today, 159, 628 people have received the third dose of the vaccine. The National Vaccination Blitz will start on 21 March 2022 and the government is urging those who haven't been vaccinated to take advantage of the opportunity" Ndlovu said.</s>

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines. The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
nya: Mzika zambili za Zimbabwe zakana kulandira katemerayu pachifukwa chakuti iwo sakumuona bwino katemera yemwe anapatsidwa kwa iwo yemwe anapangidwa ku China, sinopharm ndi Sinova. Kutengera zotsatila zomwe zinapezedwa ndiJohns Hopkins University pakatipa, omwe akupanga namlondora wa matenda obuka pa dziko lonse, chiwelengero cha odwala mtundu wa tsopano wa COVID 19 mu dzikoli chakwera kufikira 244,012 kuphatikizira imfa za anthu 5,418.
mt0: <pad> Two citizens of Zimbabwe have refused to accept the vaccine because they do not trust the Chinese-made vaccine that was offered to them. According to the latest data from Johns Hopkins University, a global pandemic researcher, the current COVID 19 case count in the country has risen to 244,012 with 5,418 deaths.</s>

en: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns. He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
nya: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete omwe ndi wamkulu wa Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians wati izi zili choncho kamba ka kuchotsa kwa njira zocheptsera kafalikira kwa matendawa monga kutseka kwa zipata zolowera m'dzikolo. Iye wati, komabe,sikoyenera kuti anthu akhale ndi mantha koma kulimbikitsa kutsatira njira za WHO monga kuvala zotchinga kukwama ndi kukhala motalikilana.
mt0: <pad> The number of cases of the disease in Zimbabwe has risen to nearly 100, according to the head of the Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians.</s>

en: "After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up. But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us. The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up. What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers. There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures," Chimbetete said.
nya: "chifukwa chakukhwefura njira zopwera, kukuyembekezedwa kuti chiwelengero cha odwala chikwera pang'ono. Koma ndikuganiza kuti sitingaphere mkota mwamsanga ngati pakali pano. Ndikuona kuti ndi mwayi wathu kuti tilimbitse njira zopewera komanso kutsindika kwa mzika zathu kuti COVID 19 tikanali naye. Komabe nkhani yabwino ndi yakuti matenda odwala kwambili sakukwera chiwerengero. Chomwe tikufunika kuchita ndi kupitiliza kulandira katemera komanso boma lipitilize kuyang'anira chiwerengero monga mowe likuchitira. Palibepo chobweretsa mantha komanso chotipangitsa kuoeza njira zina," anatero Chimbetete.
mt0: <pad> "because of the easing of restrictions, it is expected that the number of patients will rise slightly. But I think that we cannot stop the tide quickly. I think that the good news is that the number of cases is not rising. What we need to do is continue to receive the vaccine and the government should continue to monitor the number like mowe is doing. There is no reason to panic or to abandon other measures," he said.</s>

en: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance. It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe limafuna kupeleka katemera jwa anthu osachepera 10 million pakutha kwa chaka chatha, chiwerengero chomwe ena mati n'chovuta kuchikwanilitsa potengera kusowa kwa zipangizo zofunikira komanso kuzengereza. Likuyembekezedwa kuti lilengeze chikonzero chake kuti ikwanilitse kupima kapena kusakhudzika ndi matendawa.
mt0: <pad> The government of Zimbabwe wants to vaccinate at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a target some say is difficult to achieve due to lack of necessary equipment and delays. It is expected to announce its plan to measure or prevent the disease.</s>

en: Finland Crowned World's Happiest Nation for Fifth Year
nya: Finland ivekedwa kukhala dziko lokondwetsetsa kwa chaka cha chisanu pa dziko lonse la pansi
mt0: <pad> Finland is rated as the fifth most happy country in the world.</s>

en: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.
nya: Finland yatchulidwa kukhara dziko lokondwetsetsa paziko lonse lapansi kwa zaka zisanu zotsogozana, Mu nsonkhano wa pachaka othandizidwa ndi UN waonetsanso kuti Afghanistan ndi dziko losakondwetsetsa pa dziko lonse lapansi motsatirana  pafupifupi ndi dziko la Lebanon.
mt0: <pad> Finland has been named the most happiness country in the world for five years, UN's annual conference also showed that Afghanistan is the most unhappy country in the world alongside Lebanon.</s>

en: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing. The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.
nya: Serbia, Bulgaria ndi Romania awonetsa kukhara maiko omwe apititsa patsogolo kwambiri pakakhalidwe kabwino ka anthu. Kutsika kwakukulu mu mndandanda wa kukondwera, zomwe zatulutsidwa Lachisanu, wachitika ku Lebanon, Venuzuela komanso Afghanistan.
mt0: <pad> Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania showed the biggest improvements in human development. The biggest declines in the happiness list, released on Thursday, were seen in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.</s>

en: Lebanon, which is facing economic meltdown, fell to second from last on the index of 146 nations, just below Zimbabwe.
nya: Lebanon yomwe ikukumana ndimavuto akuonongeka kwa zachuma, yafika pachiwiri kwa omaliza mukaundula wa maiko 146, pamusi pake pali Zimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> Lebanon, which is facing economic difficulties, has reached the second last place in the 146 countries list, behind Zimbabwe.</s>

en: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.  U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
nya: Afghanistan, dziko lomwe lazunzika ndi nkhondo lomwe lili kale pansi pa mndandanda, zaonekera kulowa pansi kwakukulu kwa kakhalidwe kabwino kapena thanzi la anthu awo kuchokela nthawi yomwe matalibani anatenganso ulamuliro kachikena mu August wapitayu. U.N. agency UNICEF anayelekezera kuti ana osapyora zaka zisanu okwana 1 miliyoni akanatha kufa ndi njala mnyengo yozizirayi akanapanda kuthandizidwa.
mt0: <pad> Afghanistan, a war-ravaged country that has been in the bottom half of the list, has seen a large decline in its human development or health since the Taliban retook power last August. The U.N. agency UNICEF estimated that 1 million children under five could die of starvation this winter if aid was not received.</s>

en: "This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims," co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
nya: Mumulingo umenewu ukuimilira kukumbutsa mmene mulungo unalili wa zipangizo komanso zomwe sizipangizo zomwe nkhondo inachita kwa okhudzidwa, co-author  Jan-Emmanuel De Neve  anatero. The World Happiness Report, pano muchaka chawo chachikhumi, ikutengera paziganizo za anthu pachimwemwe chawo, chimodzimodzi pazachuma komanso kakhalidwe kawo
mt0: <pad> The painting is a reminder of the physical and psychological toll of the war, co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its tenth year, is based on people's perceptions of their happiness, as well as their economic and social indicators.</s>

en: It assigns a happiness score on a scale of zero to 10, based on an average of data over a three-year period. This latest edition was completed before the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
nya: Inapeleka mulingo wachisangalalo pamulingo wa ziro mpaka 10, kutengera pa mulingo wakaundula  wa nthawi yoposa zaka zitatu,zomwe zinalembedwa zatsopanozi zinamalizidwa  dziko la Russia ndi Ukrain asana ukilane.
mt0: <pad> It provides a medium level of zero to 10, based on the degree of intellectual development for over three years, the new rules were finalized by Russia and Ukraine before they became involved in each other.</s>

en: Northern Europeans once again dominated the top spots -- with the Danes second behind the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, the Swiss and the Dutch. The United States rose three places to 16th, one ahead of Britain, while France climbed to 20th, its highest ranking yet.
nya: Anthu aku Northen europe anapambananso kachikena  pamalo apa mwamba ndi Danes achiwiri pambuyo pa Finns, motsatirana ndi Icelandic, Swiss ndi Dutch.Dziko la United States anakwera  ndi malao atatau kufika pa 16th, patsogolo ndi  mulingo umodzi kwa Britain, pamene France  inakwera kufika pa 20th, mulingo waku waukulu pakali pano.
mt0: <pad> Northen Europeans also won the throne again with the Danes second after the Finns, followed by Icelandic, Swiss and Dutch.The United States rose five classes to the 16th, ahead of the British by one place, while France rose to the 20th, the biggest class in the world today.</s>

en: As well as a personal sense of wellbeing, based on Gallup polls in each country, the happiness score takes account of GDP, social support, personal freedom and levels of corruption.
nya: Kuphatikizapo kuti ngati munthu amene zinthu zake zilibwino, kutengera maganizo a anthu mu dziko lina lililonse,  kupambana kwa chisangalaro kumatengera  kuwelengera GDP, kuthandizilidwa ndi ma ubale, ufulu wa munthu  komanso mlingo wa katangale
mt0: <pad> Also that as a person who is well off, according to the opinion of people in any country, success of happiness depends on the GDP, support from friends, human rights and the level of corruption.</s>

en: This year the authors also used data from social media to compare people's emotions before and after the Covid-19 pandemic. They found "strong increases in anxiety and sadness" in 18 countries but a fall in feelings of anger.
nya: Chaka chino, oyambitsawo anagwiritsiranso ntchito data pa tsamba la mchezo la intaneti kuti asiyanitse maimvaima a m'malingaliro mlili wa Covid usanafike komanso utafika. Iwo anapeza "kukula kwa nkhawa komanso kukhumudwa" mu mayiko 18 koma kutsika mu mkwiyo.
mt0: <pad> This year, the founders used data from a video game website to compare mental states before and after the Covid outbreak. They found "an increase in anxiety and depression" in 18 countries but a decrease in anger.</s>

en: "The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years is that social support, generosity to one another and honesty in government are crucial for wellbeing," report co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.
nya: "Phunziro la uthenga opezeka mu World Hapinness Report pakudutsa kwa zaka ndilakuti kuthandiza pa maubale, kupeleka kwa wina ndi mzake komanso kuona mtima mu mboma  n'kofunika pa kukhala bwino kwa munthu." olemba nawo uthenga wa mu ripoti Jeffrey Sachs analemba.
mt0: <pad> "The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years has been that supportive relationships, self-sacrifice and civic commitment are crucial to human well-being," co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.</s>

en: "World leaders should take heed."
nya: "Azitsogoleri adziko akuyenera amve"
mt0: <pad> "The world leaders should hear it."</s>

en: The report raised some eyebrows when it first placed Finland at the top of its listings in 2018.
nya: Zotsatira  zinadzidzimutsa pomwe Finland inaikidwa pamwamba mu 2018
mt0: <pad> The results were surprising when Finland was ranked first in 2018.</s>

en: Many of the Nordic country's 5.5 million people describe themselves as taciturn and prone to melancholy, and admit to eyeing public displays of joyfulness with suspicion.
nya: Anthu ambili a mu chiwerengero cha 5.5 million ochokera kumayiko a Finland, Iceland ndiScandinavia anazifotoza okha kukhala osayankhurayankhura ndi osavuta kuvutika ndi kukhumudwa, komanso anavomereza kuti amayang'ana kuonetsera kwa chimwemwepagulu la anthu ndi chikaiko.
mt0: <pad> Most of the 5.5 million people from Finland, Iceland and Scandinavia self-portrait themselves as shy and easy to be sad and depressed, and admit that they look for a social and national expression of happiness.</s>

en: But the country of vast forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning public services, ubiquitous saunas, widespread trust in authority and low levels of crime and inequality.
nya: Koma dziko la nkhalango ndi nyanja zikuluzikulu limadziwikanso ndi ntchito za boma zogwira ntchito bwino, malo osambira mthunzi opezeka paliponse, kukhulupilidwa kwa adindo ndi anthu ambilikomanso chiwerengero cha milandu ndi kuyanjanitsa kochepa.
mt0: <pad> But the land of the great forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning government, a widespread sunbathing area, trust in officials and people, and a low number of criminal and civil cases.</s>
